thread.title: Six Nations 2017: Scotland's Brown cited for challenge on England's Daly
thread.title_full: Six Nations 2017: Scotland's Brown cited for challenge on England's Daly

title: Six Nations 2017: Scotland's Brown cited for challenge on England's Daly
text:
Read more about sharing. Fraser Brown will miss the match against Italy on Saturday if he is hit with a ban Scotland's Fraser Brown has been cited for his dangerous tackle on Elliot Daly in the Six Nations defeat by England. 
Brown was sin-binned for his challenge in the 61-21 loss on Saturday but now faces a disciplinary hearing on Tuesday to review the incident. 
He could now miss Scotland's closing Six Nations match against Italy in Edinburgh on Saturday if handed a ban. 
An independent disciplinary committee will decide if hooker Brown ought to have been handed a red card. 
French referee Mathieu Raynal chose to sin-bin Brown for the second-minute tackle on Daly after consultation with television match official (TMO) Ben Skeen. 
England retained their Six Nations title courtesy of their seven-try hammering of Scotland in London also equalling New Zealand's world-record run of 18 consecutive victories. 
The Scots have already been hit with injuries to key players, with Mark Bennett ruled out for the Italy match and six others being assessed for injuries . Share this page
